i just drove one today and was disappointed the infotainment system is terrible cluttered menu and counterintuitive and having buttons to select the gear is an idea you need to have a very peculiar mind to find useful the indicator arm was mechanical and often remains in the active position after you complete the turn the navigation was slow and fiddly unless youre a family of midgets or your passengers are pugs the backseat is only for show its hard to see where the car ends both ends the lane assist was worse than driving with an anxious motherinlaw in the backseat the worst thing was the lack of mechanical door opening to get out of the car you press a button so make sure you never run the battery to zero or you will need to break a window to escape the positives good acceleration and nice dashboard the size is of course convenient but thats common for all small cars two usb ports but the old usb2 standard instead of usbc which is the new standard and a proper space for your phone good size cup holders and the glove compartment was decent for the car size the seats were comfortably firm all in all i think this is a car that will appeal much more to women than to men they may find its quirks more charming than utilitarian men

mateorosas1272 im happy you asked if you have a 500 tubro500t abarth or a 500 after 2019 with the tubro as the only engine you must change the spark plugs at 30k intervals if not it will make the ignition coils fail eventually and cause a miss fire have the engine coolant and brake fluid flush i also recommend having your serpentine belt checked and it might need to be replaced just recently i have found out the aosair oil separator should be cleaned and gasket replaced along with the pcv valve at 40k one might not have any problems if pushed but if not taken care of can make one think they have a bad engine with light white smoke at a stop or idle it literally a 35 fixmaintenance in parts to make sure you 500 keeps running great along with your oil changes battery replacements and engine air filter changes this should help get you to 200k i happy to answer any other questions

slower 060 top speed some 30mph lower we never use top speed anyway but its a whole lot smoother and easier to drive without that awful gearbox no need for a limited slip diff as it doesnt have that surge of turbo powercant spin the wheels driving position is more comfortable seats are better its quieter and ride is smoother with the 400kg extra weight running costs will be a quarter or less our electricity is cheaper than in europe or the uk in nz we pay the equivalent of 6pkwh to charge at night when hydro power is plentiful our petrol is as expensive as yours fiat have oldtechnology batteries and motors compared to tesla so fiats ev is relatively slow and not as efficient my model 3 performance has 480bhp vs the 113bhp of the 500e yet the efficiency of the larger and heavier tesla is the same as the 500e and you can buy a used model 3 performance dual motor awd for the same money as a new 500e model 3 weighs no more than a similarlysized petrol bmw 3series awd thats probably why its such a great car multilink irs in the tesla compared to torsion beam in the 500e means theres not really any comparison in how the cars feel 500e will have that bouncy twitchy handling we know from the abarth drum rear brakes in the 500e the abarth 500e gets rear discs a bit more power 150bhp but costs even more is it worth it in the old abarth 500 compared to the lounge we had the difference in suspension tuning was obvious im not so sure that will be the case with the extra weight of the 500e platform the fiat 500e is also the same price as a brandnew basic model 3 quentin where did you get the idea that evs are better for the environment than ices not from robert llewelyn by any chance because he is totally deluded while we have in the uk some renewable generation they do not go to charging electric cars or heat pumps for that matter essentially electric cars are powered by gas it would be better to cut out the middle man and go for propane to power ic engines which would be far more efficient there are a large amount of losses between generation and consumer the reason is how our grid works nuclear and renewables run at maximum available at all times so cannot respond to the extra load evs put on the grid this is met by gas which can respond and provide the extra power the government put the horse before the cart they should have decarbonised the grid first but that can only be done by nuclear renewables havent a hope they are practically and technically unsuited for large scale grid supply dont take my word for it an inteligent assessment of this site shows real time grid performance httpswwwgridwatchtemplarcouk note particularly the red and blue in the second column of graphs red being gas and blue being wind and bear in mind that wind is always at maximum gas is variable and can rise to meet extra demand

my issue with electric cars isnt the purity its purely environmental the battery has a lifespan of 100000 miles tops before needing replacement the lithium cobalt and nickel used in the batteries is mined in horrific working conditions often using child slave labour at gunpoint the environmental impact of this is huge while ev lithium ion batteries are supposedly 95 recycleable less than 5 of ev batteries are actually recycled the effects of lithium cobalt nickel etc when returning to the earth are slightly less horrific than the child slave labour but still really bad nickel mining alone is eating away at the rainforest and if the plans to make roads fully electric in the nearish future suceed it will accelerate this process 10 fold actually a lot more than tenfold but you get the point they are not sustainable or a long term solution and rely on third world countries with abhorent working conditions for production spending 510k for a replacement battery after anywhere between 25100k miles is financially and enviromentally stupid considering how many dirty diesels have done 250000 miles with basic maintenence hell most service diesels see 400k 1000000 with regular maintenence also not to mention that our electricity grid is barely holding up as is and is not nearly renewable enough it is simply not feasible for mass ownership as of now if you want to minimize pollution of cars which itself is a tiny figure of global pollution private jets cause more pollution than all of fucking denmark combined for example and thats still a small drop in the ocean figure out how to lower diesel tailpipe emissions as the compression ratios are high enough to run on non fossil fuels if you want to do your bit through what you drive buy a car any car new old diesel petrol etc and look after it the consumer throwaway culture is maddening to me personally petition for the government to auction off the cars held under the 2008 scrappage scheme even just for parts which ruined the 2nd hand car market effecting the poorest the most and generally being a senseless waste of perfectly adequate equipment tldr if you want to drive an ev because you enjoy it no worries just dont makebe as always a great honest review and interesting insight into electric car ownership thanks ian and miss hubnut i like the idea of the onto way that you can rent the car on a month by month basis it gives potential owners the try before you buy option im a bit on the fence with electric cars i love the clever engineering behind them but am concerned about their end of life recyclability as well as the fact their labelled emission free which they arnt really one other concern is the battery life a current petrol or diesel car is designed to have a life of say 10 to 15 years most evs and hybrids seem to have battery issues within 10 years and when the battery needs replacing its a write off due to the fact the battery is basically the floorpan of the car i have never been in a position to own a new car i think the newest was 6 years old due to the cost so if i decided to go electric then i run the risk of a battery towards the end of the cars life hopefully i will be proven wrong and future batterys will be more recyclable and last longer i think electric cars have their place but are not the future i think hydrogen powered cars are the future using fuel cell power its an exciting time to be an automotive engineer thats for sure

that fiat computerised rear wiper interval really is a struggle i have a 2016 fiat doblo it doesnt have autowipers the rear wiper just wipes once every two sweeps of the front wipers however if you dont have the front wipers on it doesnt pick the slowest speed it wipes as if it was syncing with the front wipers on low continuous speed which is way too fast for just wiping spray the interval for both the front and rear wipers is also nonadjustable but speeddependant so at higher speeds theres very little difference between interval and low speed while at slower speeds the interval is sometimes too slow but it doesnt rain enough to select low speed continuous my previous car 2001 volvo v70 had adjustable interval from very very slow to alsmost continuous on the front wipers and two stages of rear wiper a nice mediumslow interval and continuous i liked that a lot better ow and to top it all off my doblo has the same wiper stalk situation as a multipla you have to twist the end for the front wipers and a ring for the rear wiper the stalk itself just moves up for one front wipe to the dash for rear wash to the driver for front wash

just had a loner one when my alfa was at service what a great little car the tech is quite good i didnt expect that honestly the screen feels little weird is its not pointing towards toe driver the powertrain feels strong and makes the car move with quite some punch around town it makes interesting ev noises which i like a lot and add the to driving experience in my opinion the normal driving mode is well calibrated and feels like a nice automatic car without applying a lot of regen braking in the other two range friendly modes the regen braking is pretty aggressive and need some getting used to the ride quality isnt the best ok earth but i was expecting way worse form a swb affordable car its not soft but the suspension did absorb bumps and road imperfections pretty nicely the build quality is somewhat inconsistent around the car some party feel well made and high quality and others seem to have been but together by a blind person in the dark for example the stitching is so bad that you dont have to look at is the figure that out it felt cheap but its doesnt really matter in my opinion the radar cruise control does a fantastic job too and its very easy to operate this car makes a lot of sens as a daily commute city car cheers

interior good soundproofing and the motor didnt sound whiny or droning inside the cab while you were talking or as it was driving by on the exterior shots only 4 things i could pick out that i didnt like were 1 the musical startstop is a cute touch that could be fun to show off but i imagine after hearing it dozens and dozens of times it could get annoying 2 i wish the roof would tuck down further for better rear visibility 3 dont like the location of the switches in the center console because they seem like they could be accidentally hit easily 4 really dont like the electric door releases if you have an electrical problem how do you open the door break a window to get out i prefer a hard connection with a normal cable latch because even if the handle or cable broke both doors wouldnt be broken at the same time the way electrically operated doors could be and you could climb across to use the other door when every single thing is electrically operated on an electric car it starts to seem gimmicky and unnecessary and just an extra power drain on the battery even if its just a tiny fraction of power that it uses ditch power door handles get rid of touch screen digital controls for the radio leave the connections on the steering wheel for safety not having to move your hands and eyes leave the climate controls as dials and switches or levers and no power operated steering column adjustments that add heavy motors that all being said its still a really nice car that i would buybut probably look for someone to modify the doors to some standard fiat door handles

allentechpt9026 my tesla and my vw both have the ability to toggle between low or high regen braking on my model s it is on screen in a menu and on my vw it is on the gear selector my previous fiat had blended brakes with minimal regen outside of pressing the brake both the fiat and vw do not have the ability to turn off creep that mimics a gas cars inability to stop moving in gear so the braking also mimics a gas car tesla lets you turn off creep mode because an electric car is not a gas car i see a lot of accidents in beep and creep but in a tesla with autopilot the car will radar lock on the car in front and accelerate and decelerate to maintain the distance pretty reliably the important thing is to continue looking out the front window and keeping hands on the wheel and feet near the pedals and not watching a movie or playing video games instead i have seen people doing the most completely stupid things in cars in traffic since the 1980s long before there were evs i submit that many accidents in evs are caused because they have a 500 horsepower vehicle that accelerates very quickly and are not used to it thats also why tires get used so quickly my tesla needed new tires at 600000 miles and again 57000 miles later the drivers ed cars where i live are all teslas
